awd_abstract_narration:
The primary goal of this project is to connect the ecosystem of disparate community practitioners and researchers within the growing, cross-disciplinary field of Secure and Trustworthy CyberSpace (SaTC) by conceptualizing, designing, building, hosting, and maintaining an open source website.  This website will advance community building, education, and collaboration in the SaTC and related research and development (R&D) program areas. These services will be enabled via the provisioning of wide-ranging information repository and collaboration services made possible via a robust content management system. The rich assortment of SaTC historic, current, and future multi-disciplinary, multi-institutional, user-provided and administrator-collected content will be provisioned into a customizable, easy to use, searchable, and interactive online format. 

The SaTC Community Forum will connect different science and engineering disciplines, R&D, and researchers and will provide robust data repositories, open collaboration services, and a rich set of virtual communication tools that currently do not exist under one roof. The SaTC Community Forum repositories could advance the state of SaTC knowledge and learning by advancing the collection and dissemination of educational materials to better prepare early career researchers; stimulate collaboration via the development of professional networks around shared resources of mutual interest; and advance the rapid publication of research findings, tools, and techniques for use by the broader SaTC research community, including industry, as a whole. These resources will be made available to users and visitors globally.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The primary goal of the SaTC CF project was to connect disparate SaTC Community practitioners within the growing, cross-disciplinary field of Secure and Trustworthy CyberSpace (SaTC) R&D by conceptualizing, designing, hosting, and maintaining a SaTC Community Forum web portal that will serve as a centralized resource for the ecosystem of SaTC R&D results and related data and information through the provision of wide-ranging information repository and collaboration services. In the form of mainly a basic information and collaboration portal, these services were enabled via collecting, vetting, curating, editing, and archiving the rich assortment of historic, current, and future multi-disciplinary, multi-institutional, user-provided and administrator- collected content provisioned into value-added, customizable, and easy to use, searchable, and interactive online formats to support community building via learning, sharing, and collaboration. The project was bootstrapped in 2017 over a three-year period. The VU project team successfully executed the SoW which included:

 Year 1:

  • Designing, staging, and testing modules on the SaTC Community Forum website
  • Purchasing and supporting a dedicated domain gateway (e.g., SaTC.org)
  • Start creating SaTC PI accounts for the current 700+ SaTC PIs
  • Start building SaTC repositories (collecting and entering data)
  • Start creating taxonomies/tagging
  • Start building PI project pages
  • Developing a communications framework for interacting with the national and international SaTC PI, Government, industry, and other stakeholder community members to collect and vet information and to enable them to post information. 
  • Holding regular project review meetings with Government sponsors

Year 2:

  • Designing and disseminate an online evaluation module to evaluate website
  • Holding regular project review meetings with Government sponsor
  • Continuing year 1 project tasks, including data curating/editing/archiving where necessary
  • Adding new NSF SaTC PI accounts to database (New PIs provided by NSF)
  • Start building searchable PI project pages

Year 3:

  • Normal operation of the SaTC Community Forum site
  • Holding regular project review meetings with Government sponsors
  • Continuing year 1 project tasks, including data curating/editing/archiving where necessary
  • Adding new NSF SaTC PI accounts to database (New PIs provided by NSF)
  • Continue building searchable PI project pages

In addition to successfully completing each year's SoW, the VU project team addressed numerous issues and requirements posed by the various NSF PDs over the three-year period that have been described in the prior NSF Annual Reports, including among other things:

  • Overhauling the look and feel in year three in comparison to the original layout released in year one
  • Via writing code to automate the creation of an award ID taxonomy during future project creation, auto-created NSF PI project awards ID taxonomy to generate missing award IDs and to link to SaTC PI projects.
  • Redesigning the SaTC CF project pages view
  • Manning a SaTC CF Help Desk at the 2019 SaTC PI Meeting to give PIs and other SaTC stakeholders an opportunity to become familiar with the site and to ask questions.

Although the SaTC CF will not receive future funding support, the site in its current instantiation will remain permanently archived at Secure and Trustworthy Cyberspace (SaTC) Community Forum | CPS-VO where current content can be searched.



Last Modified: 11/28/2021
Modified by: Frankie King

The primary goal of the SaTC CF project was to connect disparate SaTC Community practitioners within the growing, cross-disciplinary field of Secure and Trustworthy CyberSpace (SaTC) R&D by conceptualizing, designing, hosting, and maintaining a SaTC Community Forum web portal that will serve as a centralized resource for the ecosystem of SaTC R&D results and related data and information through the provision of wide-ranging information repository and collaboration services. In the form of mainly a basic information and collaboration portal, these services were enabled via collecting, vetting, curating, editing, and archiving the rich assortment of historic, current, and future multi-disciplinary, multi-institutional, user-provided and administrator- collected content provisioned into value-added, customizable, and easy to use, searchable, and interactive online formats to support community building via learning, sharing, and collaboration. The project was bootstrapped in 2017 over a three-year period. The VU project team successfully executed the SoW which included:

 Year 1:

 Designing, staging, and testing modules on the SaTC Community Forum website
Purchasing and supporting a dedicated domain gateway (e.g., SaTC.org)
Start creating SaTC PI accounts for the current 700+ SaTC PIs
Start building SaTC repositories (collecting and entering data)
Start creating taxonomies/tagging
Start building PI project pages
Developing a communications framework for interacting with the national and international SaTC PI, Government, industry, and other stakeholder community members to collect and vet information and to enable them to post information. 
Holding regular project review meetings with Government sponsors

Year 2:

Adding new NSF SaTC PI accounts to database (New PIs provided by NSF)

Year 3:

Normal operation of the SaTC Community Forum site
Holding regular project review meetings with Government sponsors
Continuing year 1 project tasks, including data curating/editing/archiving where necessary
Adding new NSF SaTC PI accounts to database (New PIs provided by NSF)

In addition to successfully completing each year's SoW, the VU project team addressed numerous issues and requirements posed by the various NSF PDs over the three-year period that have been described in the prior NSF Annual Reports, including among other things:

Overhauling the look and feel in year three in comparison to the original layout released in year one
Via writing code to automate the creation of an award ID taxonomy during future project creation, auto-created NSF PI project awards ID taxonomy to generate missing award IDs and to link to SaTC PI projects.
Redesigning the SaTC CF project pages view
Manning a SaTC CF Help Desk at the 2019 SaTC PI Meeting to give PIs and other SaTC stakeholders an opportunity to become familiar with the site and to ask questions.

Although the SaTC CF will not receive future funding support, the site in its current instantiation will remain permanently archived at Secure and Trustworthy Cyberspace (SaTC) Community Forum | CPS-VO where current content can be searched.
